padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1507059" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hanginglimbs"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/975610"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="hanginglimbs" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1507059ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1507059" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/975610">hanginglimbs</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-18">02/18/22 11:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lots of neroli and musk. The opening reminds me a lot of moist dryer air when doing laundry. The drydown releases the pear, a little cinnamon-like spice,  and is a little woodier and creamier, almost like fig, but not quite. Pleasant once you get past the oppressive citric opening, as it is evolves nicely. More unique than it will probably get credit for, but also not doing enough to justify buying this over something for $50. Reminds me of something I would smell from the Nest line.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1507059"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1507059#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1484231" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1484231" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nauditaolivia"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1344996"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1344996.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nauditaolivia" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Elie-Saab/Le-Parfum-12258.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12258.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Le Parfum"title="Le Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1484231ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1484231" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1344996">nauditaolivia</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-16">01/16/22 01:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Been wanting to buy On the Beach but a friend of mine says CD smells really nice. When I went to the store, I was torn between On the Beach and CD and I decided to buy CD because the dry down is a teeny tiny bit smells like LV Ombre Nomade.<br />
<br />
I sprayed On the Beach on my left hand and CD on my right hand (my bad for spraying LV Ombre Nomade on my dorsal and CD on my upper wrist) and I can barely smell CD when I got home (2-3 hours).<br />
<br />
I think I'm going to exchange it with On the Beach.<br />
<br />
Update: I've exchanged it with On the Beach!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1484231"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1484231#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1453051" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1453051" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ingeneuxo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1280821"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1280821.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ingeneuxo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Rose-Of-No-Man-s-Land-31931.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31931.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose Of No Man's Land"title="Rose Of No Man's Land"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1453051ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1453051" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1280821">ingeneuxo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-27">11/27/21 02:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>-Soapy citrus scent with a powdery base.<br />
-There is some mint in the background. Rather photorealistic mint leaf. <br />
-Would make for a great dumb reach for summer for those who enjoy a classy mint and citrus fragrance.<br />
-Personally I prefer Guerlain's Limon Verde, or Mandarin Basilic for that scent profile. (-)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1453051"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1453051#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1430550" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1430550" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hsiangchi.huang"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1282935"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="hsiangchi.huang" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1430550ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1430550" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1282935">hsiangchi.huang</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-18">10/18/21 20:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love the opening of this -- lively, juicy, bright, simple citrus. However, it turns very soapy after 5-10mins due to the musk. <br />
<br />
The musk here is not like in Narciso Rodriguez; it is rather soapy and even a bit plastic-like. <br />
<br />
For the price tag of this perfume, I think the scent profile could be a tad more complex.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1430550"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1430550#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1393004" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1393004" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RisingChaos"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1352837"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1352837.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="RisingChaos" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1393004ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1393004" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1352837">RisingChaos</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-15">08/15/21 22:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bright, clean musk intertwined with a very watery orange and sweet pear accords. The orange fades as it dries down but it retains the peary sweetness. It's pretty fresh and simple, easy to like. Gives me Aqua Universalis vibes, or Light Blue, but not identical by any means. Not my favorite of LV's Les Colognes, however, but I'll give it credit for it being the only one with passable performance. I get moderately strong projection for 2-3hr, longevity 12hr+ total.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1393004"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1393004#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1392081" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1364790" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Fragrancecollector2021"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349176"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1349176.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Fragrancecollector2021" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-Brulant-66125.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66125.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Soleil Brlant"title="Soleil Brlant"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1364790ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1364790" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349176">Fragrancecollector2021</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-23">06/23/21 12:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought this as a blind buy, was I happy not initially , but as I wore it a few more times and I think the bottle settled over a few weeks it got better and better and better, I love the sharp twang at the start as you spritz, this mellows down with sharp spots of sweetness like I always spray pulse points I find myself smelling my wrists way too often.<br />
The musk and benzoin are balanced and the bottle looks brilliant although I normally keep my bottles in their boxes and inner casings.<br />
<br />
In closing I love this fragrance I also have L'immensite which I use way more ( review to come).<br />
<br />
If you are happy with average longevity ie 5 hours and sweet, salty sunshine get a sample and I'm sure the full bottle will make it's way to your collection.<br />
<br />
I will be buying a back up bottle to add to my ever growing collection.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1364790"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1364790#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1361075" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1361075" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="joseffgabriel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1073751"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1073751.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="joseffgabriel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1361075ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1361075" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1073751">joseffgabriel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-16">06/16/21 14:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I can smell the ambrette, mandarin, benzoin, musk and a sweet fruit touch not exactly pear. Well blended trio of sweet, tart, zingy. It is airy, transparent and projects too little. The fruits play with the musks so well that it paints a dreamy pink fantasy in my imagination especially the ambrette reminds me of baby necklaces. I just wish they could've add a little heft to it. This isn't like Petit Matin ehich has neroli and lavender, this one is fruity and has acidic fruits. Works like a cologne and you can overspray this one. Not much development like Xerjoff and other brands that is on $200 mark.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1361075"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1361075#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1358355" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1358355" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Garren88"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1227814"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1227814.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Garren88" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1358355ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1358355" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1227814">Garren88</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-11">06/11/21 10:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Update: I wore this today (its currently becoming warmer in Scotland) and the heat certainly brings this to life! I was worried that a few weeks ago this was a poor performer in terms or performance and Silliage, but today proved me wrong!! Still smells great after an 8 hour shift and I just reapplied to go out to dinner! Happy!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1358355"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1358355#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1355411" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1355411" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Grey.ackerman23"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1346652"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1346652.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Grey.ackerman23" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51016.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Attrape-Rves"title="Attrape-Rves"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1355411ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1355411" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1346652">Grey.ackerman23</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-06">06/06/21 03:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fresh. Clean. A little bit strong citrus and musk in the opening.<br />
So refreshing when I spray it in the mid day. Feels like, I just finished take a bath at the very hot high noon. I am new in this fragworld, so I'm sorry if I can't describing it so well.<br />
Also, this fragrance is very long lasting. I remember when I spray it on my shirt and then I washed the shirt. I can still sniffed the scent (fresh and citrusy)!<br />
Unfortunately, the price is crazy expensive</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1355411"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1355411#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1354419" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1354419" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Djedi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/373232"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.373232.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Djedi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1354419ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1354419" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/373232">Djedi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-04">06/04/21 10:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The opening is a bit strange  as it simultaneously smells pleasant and off-putting. The citrus-mandarin opening is blended with musks which in return comes off as screechy or synthetic (chemical) at times. However, once it settles down onto the skin it's a fairly pleasant musky citrus fragrance with perhaps the slightest accord of something fruity buried in the back. Unisex. Performance is average. Overpriced in my opinion but I do enjoy wearing this one.<br />
<br />
7/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1354419"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1354419#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1346916" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Its an annoyingly sharp citrus scent that then transforms into a weird metallic musky smell. I am not a fan of citrus though so take this with that perspective in mind. Its very sharp though, nose piercingly so. Maybe if you like citrus scent this is a go? It unfortunately last a good amount of time on the skin and lingers around in the air so good longevity and sillage for a citrus summer scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1333274" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Garren88"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1227814"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1227814.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Garren88" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1333274ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1333274" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1227814">Garren88</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-27">04/27/21 11:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought this and used it for a few days before posting a review. I am in love! All these notes should be so sharp, but for some reason its so well blended and smooth!<br />
<br />
Definitely a summer fragrance, as a male I find it perfectly unisex. The citrusy, amber musk sits perfect on my skin. I cannot tell you the amount of compliments Ive received this week on this!<br />
<br />
In my opinion, its overpriced but for the luxury, Id pay it again. Makes me wanna try the others in the collection!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1333274"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1333274#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1329855" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1329855" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="silkyb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1318714"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1318714.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="silkyb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1329855ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1329855" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1318714">silkyb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-21">04/21/21 21:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Jacques Cavallier has this incredible talent taking notes that would usually be sharp and making them soft and round. It's a beautiful signature he's given to LV. California Dream is everything I hoped it would be. On the initial spritz you get the beautiful rounded and soft Mandarin orange. Once it starts to gently dry down, that soft musk comes into play and lingers dancing around your skin. In my honest, humble opinion, it's my favorite from LV. It really, really reminds me of dusk on the California beaches or driving down PCH with the windows down. It has just the right amount of sillage and marvelous longevity. It even passed my sweater test. I smelled it the next day. Someone already asked what I was wearing because it smelled amazing. Happy spritzing! -Silky</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1329855"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1329855#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1327655" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1327655" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PerfumePizza"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1290030"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1290030.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PerfumePizza" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1327655ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1327655" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1290030">PerfumePizza</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-18">04/18/21 08:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Took my shades out, sprayed on some perfume, and went into the sun today! Scent of the day is California Dream by Louis Vuitton. Perfumes can bring you back to memory lane, but they can also provide us memories that we never had! For instance, I've never been to Los Angeles, yet this fragrance manages to give me an LA vibe! From what I've seen in movies this fragrance reflect a vintage sunny beach day at the boulevard. It opens up strong with a sparkling mandarine with added sweatness of pear. It manages to stay fresh for a very long because of the base of the perfume which contains musk, ambrette and benzoin. Especially the mandarin with musk gives of the vintage freshness. I am probably biased towards that feeling because of the name of the perfume (California) and the colours of the bottle. The pinkish bottem with the blue top looks like the reflection of a sunset in the water. Despite knowing that I'm most likely influenced by the presentation, California Dream is still a wonderfull longlasting fresh fragrance perfect underneath the sun!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1327655"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1327655#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1326880" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1326880" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nessers"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1005326"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1005326.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nessers" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Lustre-97927.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.97927.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lustre"title="Lustre"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1326880ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1326880" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1005326">Nessers</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-16">04/16/21 19:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>EDIT 08-16-21:<br />
<br />
The longevity is pretty bad. Lasts maybe an hour? That's disappointing because LV is so expensive. This should be a luxury product, and yet, it's almost like an EDT.<br />
<br />
---<br />
<br />
I tried both this and Afternoon Sun today.<br />
<br />
AS is beautiful. So is this, CA Dream. Both have that burst of orange in the top notes. Almost an orange in its totality: the fruit, the peel, the leaf, the twig.<br />
<br />
CA Dream is sweeter than Afternoon Sun in its drydown. Here, it turns feminine. Soft, sweet musk. It's hard to say which is better because they're both gorgeous. I'm hard to please as well.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1326880"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1326880#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1315920" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1315920" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Esna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/130358"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.130358.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="Esna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Headspace/Kirsch-Headspace-86159.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.86159.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Kirsch Headspace"title="Kirsch Headspace"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1315920ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1315920" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/130358">Esna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-29">03/29/21 08:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Super clean expensive soap. The fruityness isn't from fresh fruit but more of an icy classic push up Flinstones sherbet in the hot sun.  <br />
<br />
It immediately reminded me of an old polaroid that I have of myself back in 1989. Im in a ranch in a small west Texas town. Im freshly bathed and my hair smells like pink bubble gum from Mr. Bubble Bath. Im wearing a shiny blue bathing suit. The hot sun glistening on my skin as I sit on the trunk of my rich aunts shiny new brown Cadillac. She brings me a glass of cold blue raspberry koolaid as Im getting ready to play with the water hose.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1315920"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1315920#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1305141" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1305141" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mhegu13"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1222902"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="mhegu13" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1305141ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1305141" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1222902">mhegu13</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-09">03/09/21 18:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lv fragrances are so expensive and im not sure if they're bottle worthy but the ones ive been eyeing are mille feux, rose des vents, heures d absence, contre moi, and this. I finally pulled the trigger and got contre moi instead because i love vanilla but luckily, i got a sample of this, california dreams... in the initial opening it reminded me of diptyque's eau des sens but i thought there's still something this reminds me of and i cant stop thinking about it. Finally, i remember! It also reminds me of mfk's gfs!  <br />
...california dream is so fresh and to me it leans more masculine but def unisex and is perfect for summer</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1305141"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1305141#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1277469" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Moderate sillage and long lasting longevity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1277469"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1277469#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1248028" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Perfectly unisex, performance is very good for the fresh scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1248028"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1248028#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1230852" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1230852" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jennyfefs"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1205495"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="jennyfefs" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/En-Passant-2793.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2793.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="En Passant"title="En Passant"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1230852ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1230852" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1205495">jennyfefs</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-09-30">09/30/20 05:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Got a tester of this because the bottle is so beautiful and I really want it for my shelf!<br />
There have been very mixed reviews on this and it's a strange one for sure.<br />
It has a very floral, lemony initial scent which is feminine and light but dries down to a citrus musk.<br />
Imagine getting a lemon and dipping it in slightly burnt caramel. That's what I'm smelling as I walk around. It's quite lovely.<br />
The skin scent, however, is quite a dirty musk which I don't hugely enjoy.<br />
The caramel note reminds me a little of Baccarat Rouge caramel without the hospital smell.<br />
Need to wear for a day and see how I feel but at the moment, I'm getting gourmand which is not what I expected.<br />
<br />
Edited to say, I have worn this for a day and I absolutely hate it. It has turned into a dusty, musky Granny smell. I imagine Miss Havisham would smell something similar. I won't be buying this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1230852"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1230852#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1217272" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Fruity and fresh but grown up. I've been looking for another Summer scent. My favorite is Light Blue Intense.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1217272"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1217272#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1213088" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1213088" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dominicgoyer"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1231919"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1231919.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dominicgoyer" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1213088ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1213088" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1231919">dominicgoyer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-08-18">08/18/20 08:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is an interesting little fellow:<br />
Started almost like a floral citrus. <br />
It really felt feminine and... generic on me.<br />
Was I fooled by the pink bottle?<br />
And then it switched into something more interesting probably the benzoin kicking in.<br />
It does feels modern and synthetic.<br />
Very different than the other three of the line in my opinion.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1213088"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1213088#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1209748" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1209748" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MrBolton"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1161847"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1161847.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MrBolton" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Acqua-di-Parma/Chinotto-di-Liguria-48940.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48940.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chinotto di Liguria"title="Chinotto di Liguria"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1209748ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1209748" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86); <br />
If this performs and smells like Creed's Jardin d'Amalfi, on the skin, then I think it's worth the price. That's a masterpiece!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1209748"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1209748#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1207278" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1207278" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="_smellingreat_"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1228883"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1228883.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="_smellingreat_" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nasomatto/Fantomas-62775.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62775.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fantomas"title="Fantomas"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1207278ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1207278" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1228883">_smellingreat_</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-08-04">08/04/20 00:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is great little summer addition. It holds similar DNA to the others in the LV summer collection (first blast reminded me of both Afternoon Swim and Sun Song), then it calms down into a really pleasant citrus/ fruity musk. I would say this is perfectly unisex does not lean fem at all. Decent longevity, silage- still testing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1207278"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1207278#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1195442" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1195442" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mjkpecwt"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/354513"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.354513.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mjkpecwt" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Galion/Chypre-2020-63459.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.63459.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chypre (2020)"title="Chypre (2020)"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1195442ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1195442" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1195442"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1195442#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1189218" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1189218" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="le feu"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/10030"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.10030.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="le feu" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Levar-del-Sole-93107.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.93107.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Levar del Sole"title="Levar del Sole"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1189218ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1189218" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/10030">le feu</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-06-16">06/16/20 17:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not exactly what I had been dreaming about. Opens as Le Jardin de Monsieur Li and almost immediately goes toward Florentine Iris Ermenegildo Zegna. Im puzzled what note gives such a sharp masculine vibe? I smell something oudsy-leathery but non of them announced here.... California Dream and Iris Florentine both were created by Jacques Cavalier so I think anyone who likes Iris can try this one. <br />
PS... seems like this masculine vibe comes from particular type of musk ( heavy and sharp like in Arabian perfumery, Xerjoff) and ambrette.<br />
<br />
Another 13?!!!! nooooo...... not even close!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1189218"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1189218#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1189009" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1187349" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sam.newman"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1241735"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1241735.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sam.newman" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1187349ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1187349" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1241735">sam.newman</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-06-12">06/12/20 03:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Clean fresh mandarin.<br />
The addition of pear and musk makes it less citrusy, which is good in my books. But still very much a day/summer scent.<br />
<br />
This starts off very feminine but dries to be unisex.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1187349"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1187349#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1186625" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1186625" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dennispetrospour"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1187792"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1187792.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dennispetrospour" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1186625ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1186625" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1187792">dennispetrospour</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-06-10">06/10/20 13:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>def a summer banger, smells like mandarin and pear to me. especially in heat this will do very well. Great scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1186625"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1186625#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1183020" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1183020" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HungarianGenius"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1195937"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1195937.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="HungarianGenius" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Terre-d-Hermes-Eau-Givree-72439.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72439.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Terre d'Hermes Eau Givree"title="Terre d'Hermes Eau Givree"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1183020ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1183020" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1195937">HungarianGenius</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-06-01">06/01/20 17:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The benzoin, ambrette, musk and pear notes had me expecting something in the direction of Another 13, which this definitely isn't..<br />
<br />
Its a photorealistic mandarin through and through, this aspect is very impressive. Its like the whole process of picking up a mandarin, smelling it, breaking into its rind then peeling it, and finally eating its juicy flesh but played out over a 6 hour drydown. The musk is the other major note, the pear is noticeable, the ambrette and benzoin not so much.<br />
California Dream definitely belongs in the Les Colognes collection, so if you are expecting something more complex with interesting development, this unfortunately isn't it.<br />
The bottle is just gorgeous and almost made me blind buy, fortunately i sampled first and im glad i did as i was looking for something more than a super juicy citrus musk.<br />
<br />
I will revisit it in summer as im sure i will appreciate it a whole lot more.<br />
<br />
Longevity is impressive for what it is, projection is low-average, perhaps it will pop better in heat.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1183020"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1183020#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1181752" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1181752" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Essarai"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1236293"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1236293.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Essarai" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Spell-On-You-68960.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68960.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Spell On You"title="Spell On You"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1181752ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1181752" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1236293">Essarai</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-05-29">05/29/20 09:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I blind bought this and was excited to experience the story.  Instant mandarin top notes hurriedly usher you in and leave you in the hands of musky ambrette and cotton candy bezoin who step in and finish the journey.  This is a musk dominant fragrance.<br />
<br />
For me, the four Summer Fragrances from LV tell a story.  Sun Song cheerfully starts the day with neroli and bergamot happiness leading to a meditation in the Cactus Garden at the height of noon, where lime and mate tea contemplate the heat.  Afternoon Swim is literally that perfect splash that refreshes you during siesta time and finally, California Dream finishes the day, enveloping you in a cozy, cashmere throw as the summer sun sets on the waters.<br />
<br />
As a male in my 30s, I definitely feel like California Dream leans the most feminine out of the four unisex perfumes in the summer LV collection.  The ambrette and benzoin make this perfume feel less energetic than Sun Song which has a musk base note.  If you dont like a musk predominant fragrance, this is not the one for you.<br />
<br />
Wouldn't blind buy this one, it's personally my least favorite of the four summer EDPs as Im not a big musk fan.  Sillage is great, definitely dances around the room and it has lasted 6-8 hours on dry skin. Get a sample and see if you relate to it first.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1181752"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1181752#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1181462" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1181462" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mmcdonald36"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1049531"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="mmcdonald36" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1181462ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1181462" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1049531">mmcdonald36</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-05-28">05/28/20 15:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Upon first spray it did not immediately remind me of anything else (thats a good thing). Then I detected mandarin but not in a classic Italian cologne style like Mandarino di Amalfi. Immediately I was struck by how modern the fragrance smells. Once it settled on my skin I first thought of Dior Homme Cologne with all of that bergamot and musk. But the thing that sets this fragrance apart from something like Dior Homme Cologne is the sweet ozonic electric musk accord that I am getting from it. That is not an actual term, a sweet ozonic electric musk, but its how I would describe what I am smelling. Someone below me guessed this would smell like Le Labo Another 13, and in a way they are correct. Take Dior Homme Cologne, mix it with some Another 13, and implement a sweet modern mandarin note and thats what you get with California Dream. Totally unisex in my opinion. I really enjoy this one, but I can tell it needs heat to perform, hence why it was placed in the Cologne collection. Solid stuff.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="60388"comment_id="1181462"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/California-Dream-60388.html?ccid=1181462#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1160978" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
